title: (x) Daphne Du Maurier "Daphne" original book cover - Corvinus {Stéphane Darricau}
content:
Hi Everyone

Bit of a tough one here I think, its a very old book cover and I don’t think I’ve seen anything like it before.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:DaphneDuMaurier\_Rebecca\_first.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:DaphneDuMaurier_Rebecca_first.jpg "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:DaphneDuMaurier\_Rebecca\_first.jpg")

If anyone has a clue that would be great!

Thanks

Jono

 [‹ "Beat" vintage looking serif capitals w/ round 'E'](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44063 "Go to previous forum topic") [Curly child-like hand printed script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44059 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mrjono

comments.content: Thats a good shout but its not quite there. The uppercase C on the book cover is very distinctive and is different to Corvinus.

This is Corvinus though — see [this digitization](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/skyline/) by [Ian Patterson](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Ian%252BPatterson) for The Font Bureau, Inc.

Hi Jono, there are several digital versions of Corvinus/Glamour: - [Fontbureau’s Skyline](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/skyline/) Skyline was commissioned from Font Bureau by Condé Nast specifically as headletter for Traveler magazine. This strongly personal work of Imre Reiner from 1929 and 1934 was known in Europe as Corvinus. - LTC Glamour
Glamour was originally released by Lanston Monotype in 1948. It is based on Corvinus designed by Imre Reiner. - [URW Glamour](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/glamour/) - [Corvinus Skyline](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/apcorvinus-skyline/familytree.html) - [OL Corvinus](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-corvinus/familytree.html)
In the Visual Graphics Corp. Phototype catalogs from the 1970s it is called Corvinus Bold. The other versions they show all have the thicker end on the C etc.

Brilliant! Thanks guys. I’m going to go with the LTC Glamour.

Thanks to everyone for all your help.

Jono
LTC Glamour Bold looks really close to your book cover.
